column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=In the beginning , what challenges did you face inside and outside CERN in the development of this cutting-edge technology ?
#Text=A lot of incomprehension , later also some jealousy .
#Text=And at the start it was difficult to convince the managers that it would grow into a useful tool .
#Text=There were a number of factors against us .
#Text=First , the period of home-grown IT solutions was over .
#Text=The trend was to buy off-the-shelf software .

#Text=Secondly , the entire future of high-energy physics was precarious : there were troubles around the SSC ( Superconducting Super Collider , red . ) in the U.S. and from the plans of the LHC ( Large Hadron Collider , red . )
#Text=it was clear that something had to give .
#Text=The SSC was finally scrapped in 1993 , but during the entire period the physicists were worrying about other things than hypertexts .
#Text=Thirdly , there was always the problem of justifying a project in pure computing within an institute whose mandate is very clearly the science of pure physics .
#Text=Outside CERN there was a desert of hopelessly confused networking .
#Text=Universities wanted TCP/IP but the telecoms of the European countries were still governmental monopolies , and they resisted this because they were used to different payment schemes .
#Text=I remember a funny exchange between a person from Deutsche Telekom and a group of academics at a conference : they complained about the costs and the slow links .
#Text=The telecom person replied : " What do you want ?

#Text=He raised his eyebrows and said :  Monsieur , vous ne pensez quand-même pas que France Telecom va soutenir l'internet ? "

column1: #Text=( " Sir , I hope you do not expect that France Telecom will support the internet ? " ) .
#Text=And all that happened when the web was already a success , though indeed only in the academic world .
#Text=File : Premier serveur Web . jpeg
#Text=The first web server .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=Early browsers were web editors at the same time right ?
#Text=What browser do you use today ?
#Text=Does it have tabbed browsing ?
#Text=How does it compare to the early browsers you 've worked with ?
#Text=It is true that the browser of the NeXT was also the editor , though it was restricted to the pages on the local server .
#Text=The current complexity of XHTML , Ajax , CSS etc. precludes I think the efficient combination of the functions of editing and browsing in a single application .
